title.narrative: SWE-2011-27 The possibilities and challenges for gender neutral pro-poor agricultural growth in Malawi and Zambia
SWE-2011-27 The possibilities and challenges for gender neutral pro-poor agricultural growth in Malawi and Zambia

description.narrative: An interdisciplinary approach will consider localized, gendered aspects of pro-poor agricultural growth. This is especially relevant in sub-Saharan Africa where women constitute 49 per cent of the agricultural labour force while female control of productive resources is limited. The project considers context specific dynamics of pro-poor agricultural growth, the gendered aspects of access to productive resources and markets and the institutional challenges of encouraging gender inclusivity in this process. Differences between households headed by men and women and among men and women within households will be studied. The study will resurvey 880 households in sixteen villages surveyed in 2002 and 2008. Qualitative methods at individual, household and village level will complement the quantitative data while enabling further development of the quantitative data collection instrument.

An interdisciplinary approach will consider localized, gendered aspects of pro-poor agricultural growth. The project considers context specific dynamics of pro-poor agricultural growth, the gendered aspects of access to productive resources and markets and the institutional challenges of encouraging gender inclusivity in this process. Differences between households headed by men and women and among men and women within households will be studied. The study will resurvey 880 households in sixteen villages surveyed in 2002 and 2008. Qualitative methods at individual, household and village level will complement the quantitative data while enabling further development of the quantitative data collection instrument.
